sections.MISSION:
Medical Platoon executes Squad Field Training Exercise from 06-09 JUN 23 at the Urban Ops Site and Land NAV West in the Grafenwoehr Training Area IOT validate Squads’ ability to conduct PLT Role 1 medical operations, evacuation, and individual skills.
3.
sections.INTENT: – : Lifeline sections are trained and evaluated on their specific functions within the platoon to increase the SQDNs RTD time and decrease killed in action rate.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Conducted in compliance with the 5 day recovery model and CLVIII shortages are ordered.
PA 257
Urban Ops
N
2.
sections.END STATE:
All Lifeline Medics and sections are trained and certified on their medical and tactical skills, their equipment, and knowledge of SQDN and GTA EVAC SOPs.
3.
sections.TASKS:
to Troops:
-A TRP, B TRP, C TRP:
Provide all 68Ws and MEV crews for training and certification from 03-05JUN23
4.
sections.SUSTAINMENT:
Class I: A-M-A
Class II: 3x Rescue Randy, 2x Moulage Kit, 3x respiratory mannequins
Class III: 20 Gallon Resupply Class IV: N/A
Class V: 10 x Arty Sims, 9 violet smoke, 9 white smoke
Class VIII: Expenditures resupplied through RMSO

MED PLT Day PLT Training Cycle
PACK OUT
DAY 1
DAY 2
0930-1130: SMs report to MP for Tent, generators, heaters and TCMC sets load out into HHT 7-7/7-9.
1130-1300: Lunch time.
1300: Review load plan and account for any alibis.
1400-1600:individual SMs pack out and TL PCCs/PCIs.
1615-UTC: Layout for SMs final PCCs/PCIs conducted by SLs
0530: Arrive at MP
0600: PCC/PCIs
0630: Radio Check
0700-0800: Breakfast Chow
0810: Ramp Brief
0820: REDCON1
0830: SP
0845: Arrive at PA 157
0530: Arrive at MP
0600: PCC/PCIs
0630: Install COMMO equipment
0700-0800: Breakfast Chow
0830: Comm Check
0930: REDCON1
0940: SP
1000: Arrive at PA 157
1000-1100: Establish a Battalion Aid Station IAW (ATP 4-02.4, TOE 08-PLT-0221)
EVAC Squad will be monitoring comms/JBCP for HHT 7-1, generator, medical equipment, lights and heaters set up
1100-1130:CHOW/REST KEY LEADER SYNC EVAC SL briefs evac plan and routes to PSG and MEDO (TOE 08-PLT-0319 Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support) TRMT SL will also brief on bed teams and sick call operations (OP 4.4.3 Provide Health Services)
1100-1130:CHOW/REST KEY LEADER SYNC EVAC SL briefs evac plan and routes to PSG and MEDO (TOE 08-PLT-0319 Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support) TRMT SL will also brief on bed teams and sick call operations (OP 4.4.3 Provide Health Services)
1145-1230: EVAC SECTION conducts route recon and handle any alibis for section.
1145-1230:TRMT Section continues to refine TRMTarea working in conjunction with Physicians ensuring patient flow and necessary equipment is present (Coordinate Patient Movement 081-70B-2013)
1300-1350: TRMT section Patient flow class 1400-1450: Maintain Readiness of Assigned Medical Equipment familiarization class
1500-1600: begin break down and pack out of Role I
1615-1715: Establish a Battalion Aid Station IAW (ATP 4-02.4, TOE 08-PLT-0221) 1730-1800: dinner chow/KEY LEADER SYNC and Yellow II reports due. 1830-1930: discuss work rest cycle and Est TRMT team through the night. Refuel ops for vehicles and generator and heaters
2000: Lights outs
0700: Wake Up
0730-0830: Chow
0830-1030: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319) Each TRP EVAC Squad will be conducting simulated Combat Evacuation Lanes. PLT CCP to TRP CCP.
Provide POI Care (081-68W-0170) Load Casualties onto Ground Ambulances (081-000-1015) Provide En route Care (ATP 4-02.13, T&OE: 08-TM-4000)
Unload Casualties from a Ground Ambulance (081-000-1016)
1030-1200: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319) TRP CCP to AXP
Establish an Ambulance Exchange Point (T&OE: 081-000-0088)
1200-1300: Chow/Rest EVAC SL will explain Evaluation Lanes, and brief the DECM Scenario to Leadership.
1300-1430: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319)
AXP to ROLE 1 1430-1530: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319)
ROLE 1 to AXP 2 1600-UTC: SMs will start providing Prolonged Field Care (DECM) to the Patients arriving to the Role 1.
Perform Prolonged Field Care (T&OE: 331-CAM-1006)
UTC: SMs will continue to provide Prolonged Field Care (DECM) to the Patients that arrived to the Role 1.
Perform Prolonged Field Care (T&OE: 331-CAM-1006)
0700: Wake Up
0730-0830: Chow
0830-1030: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319) Each TRP EVAC Squad will be conducting simulated Combat Evacuation Lanes. PLT CCP to TRP CCP.

Provide En route Care (ATP 4-02.13, T&OE: 08-TM-4000)

Establish an Ambulance Exchange Point (T&OE: 081-000-0088)
1200-1300: Chow/Rest EVAC SL will explain Evaluation Lanes, and brief the DECM Scenario to Leadership.
1300-1430: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319)
AXP to ROLE 1 1430-1530: Provide Ground Ambulance Evacuation Support Lanes IAW (ATP 4-02.2, 08-TM-0319)
ROLE 1 to AXP 2 1600: PLT AAR
1630: Packout

PHASE 1: Planning
Key Task: COMMEX completed and each medic has a copy of the PLT SOPs
Phase 2: Medical STX (06-08 JUN)
Key task: Casualties are treated with best practice and evacuated to higher level of care. All Patients are accurately tracked. Phase 3: Land Navigation (09 JUN)

RISK ASSESSMENT MATRIX
Probability (Expected frequency)
Frequent:

regular, or

occurences

numerous 
occurences

occurences

occurences

occurences 
but

death, unacceptable loss or damage

capability; severe injury, illness, loss or damage

H - High Risk
M - Medium Risk
